title: hESC-beta and diabetes human insulin in mice 4

content.question: In contrast to type 1 diabetes, where there is no insulin production, type 2 diabetes is characterized by a failure of body cells to respond normally to insulin. Based on the results of the experiment, which of the following best predicts the effectiveness of using hESC-β implantation to treat type 2 diabetes?

choices.label: The treatment would fail because insulin produced by implanted hESC-β cells will not stimulate glucose uptake by body cells.
The treatment would fail because the implanted hESC-β cells would require more glucose than the body can produce.
The treatment would succeed because the implanted hESC-β cells can express the gene that codes for human insulin.
The treatment would succeed because the body cells would secrete more insulin in the presence of the implanted hESC-β cells.

content.answer: The treatment would fail because insulin produced by implanted hESC-β cells will not stimulate glucose uptake by body cells.
